text: [Music]
hello I'm Gotham a supporting member
here at AWS office in Bangalore India
sometimes the pace of an AWS
organization ask me how does credit
sharing work so let me explain the study
by default the credits on accounts in an
organization in any account payer or
linked are shared with all the accounts
within the organization's consolidated
bill if you want to use the credits only
on the account they are attached to then
you can disable the credit sharing
feature on the Pierre account once
disabled credits will only be allocated
to usage incurred by the credits owner
account and any residual credit amount
will not be applied to usage incurred in
the current month if the credits are not
expired then the residual credit amount
will be applied on the owners account in
the following months now I will go
through the steps of disabling credit
sharing sign in to the AWS management
console of the payer account only and
navigate to the billing and cost
management console in the navigation
pane choose preferences click on the
check box besides disable credit sharing
choose save preferences click on save
thanks for watching and a happy cloud
computing from all of us here at AWS
you
